column4: I'm trying to get a simple text to speech engine with a gui - I've tried verbose, lsr... I just can't seem to get any of these programs to work - can anyone assist?
seriously - if I have a pdf document? or a webpage
do I have to copy that entire thing to a text file?
isn't there a gui or something
there is a pidgin plugin that will speak your chats
what happens if he just deletes sources.list ?  won't synaptic fix it
hwilde... I need a speech engine for webpages - that's all - why is this so difficult?
did you google this at all?  http://ubuntuforums.org/archive/index.php/t-363915.html  How-To Install Click, Speak, a Web-page Reader (Text-to-Speech) Firefox Extension
http://ubuntuforums.org/showthread.php?t=363915    Reload this Page  How-To Install Click, Speak, a Web-page Reader (Text-to-Speech) Firefox Extension
